prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in physics would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in physics would. Completely simplify and rationalize the denominator: $$\frac{\sqrt{160}}{\sqrt{252}}\times\frac{\sqrt{245}}{\sqrt{108}}$$
gpt_response:
To simplify the given expression, we first simplify each square root in the numerator and denominator:

$$\frac{\sqrt{160}}{\sqrt{252}}\times\frac{\sqrt{245}}{\sqrt{108}}$$
$$=\frac{\sqrt{16 \times 10}}{\sqrt{36 \times 7}}\times\frac{\sqrt{49 \times 5}}{\sqrt{36 \times 3}}$$
$$=\frac{\sqrt{16}\times\sqrt{10}}{\sqrt{36}\times\sqrt{7}}\times\frac{\sqrt{49}\times\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{36}\times\sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{4\sqrt{10}}{6\sqrt{7}}\times\frac{7\sqrt{5}}{6\sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{4 \times 7 \times \sqrt{10 \times 5}}{6 \times 6 \times \sqrt{7 \times 3}}$$
$$=\frac{28\sqrt{50}}{36\sqrt{21}}$$
$$=\frac{28 \times 5 \times \sqrt{2}}{36 \times \sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{140\sqrt{2}}{36\sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{70\sqrt{2}}{18\sqrt{3}}$$

Thus, the completely simplified and rationalized form of the denominator is $\frac{70\sqrt{2}}{18\sqrt{3}}$.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response \frac{5\sqrt{42}}{27}?: To simplify the given expression, we first simplify each square root in the numerator and denominator:

$$\frac{\sqrt{160}}{\sqrt{252}}\times\frac{\sqrt{245}}{\sqrt{108}}$$
$$=\frac{\sqrt{16 \times 10}}{\sqrt{36 \times 7}}\times\frac{\sqrt{49 \times 5}}{\sqrt{36 \times 3}}$$
$$=\frac{\sqrt{16}\times\sqrt{10}}{\sqrt{36}\times\sqrt{7}}\times\frac{\sqrt{49}\times\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{36}\times\sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{4\sqrt{10}}{6\sqrt{7}}\times\frac{7\sqrt{5}}{6\sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{4 \times 7 \times \sqrt{10 \times 5}}{6 \times 6 \times \sqrt{7 \times 3}}$$
$$=\frac{28\sqrt{50}}{36\sqrt{21}}$$
$$=\frac{28 \times 5 \times \sqrt{2}}{36 \times \sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{140\sqrt{2}}{36\sqrt{3}}$$
$$=\frac{70\sqrt{2}}{18\sqrt{3}}$$

Thus, the completely simplified and rationalized form of the denominator is $\frac{70\sqrt{2}}{18\sqrt{3}}$.
gpt_response_correct_incorrect: No. The final solution obtained is not \frac{5\sqrt{42}}{27}.
